solution_line_template: Marvin sold {marvin_candy_bars_sold} candy bars at ${candy_bar_cost} each so {marvin_candy_bars_sold} * {candy_bar_cost} = $<<{marvin_candy_bars_sold}*{candy_bar_cost}={marvin_money_made}>>{marvin_money_made} worth of candy
Tina sold three times the amount of candy so ${marvin_money_made} * {tina_multiplier} = $<<{marvin_money_made}*{tina_multiplier}={tina_money_made}>>{tina_money_made} worth of candy

If Tina sold ${tina_money_made} worth of candy and Marvin sold ${marvin_money_made} in candy then {tina_money_made} - {marvin_money_made} = $<<{tina_money_made}-{marvin_money_made}={money_difference}>>{money_difference} more sold than Marvin
